events.event_name: Japan S&P Global Composite PMI Release January 2026
events.description: The release of the revised Composite PMI data for Japan showing an increase to 53.1.

facts.fact_text: Japan’s S&P Global Composite PMI rose to 53.1 in January 2026, up from 51.1 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: Japan’s S&P Global Composite PMI rose to 53.1 in January 2026, above the flash estimate of 52.8 and up from 51.1 in December.

facts.fact_text: Export orders returned to growth for the first time since March 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: Export orders also returned to growth for the first time since last March and at the strongest pace in more than four years.

facts.fact_text: Selling price inflation reached its highest rate in over 18 months.

evidences.evidence_text: selling price inflation accelerated to its fastest rate in over 18 months.

claims.claim_text: The growth momentum was caused by stronger services activity and increased factory output.
claims.author: S&P Global

evidences.evidence_text: Momentum was driven by a stronger pickup in services activity alongside a renewed increase in factory output.

evidence.evidence_text: Momentum was driven by a stronger pickup in services activity
alongside a renewed increase in factory output.
Firms continued to raise staffing levels at a solid clip as order backlogs accumulated.
selling price inflation accelerated to its fastest rate in over 18 months.
